alert.note: Alert for Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central North Dakota, including the following county, Morton. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams including Rice Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM CDT, Thunderstorms producing heavy rain have ended over the advisory area, however some moderate slow moving showers remain. In addition, it will take time for the heavy rain that fell in southern Morton county, to make it`s way through the minor creeks and streams, and into the Cannonball and Missouri Rivers. - Doppler radar indicated between 2 and 5 inches of rain from 5 to 10 miles west of Huff, south to the Missouri River near Fort Rice, and to just north of the Cannonball River, between Solen and Cannon Ball. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Rice.
info.instruction: Do not cross flooded roadways. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
